but doesn't really work and is it safe
I'm about to find out dr. Charlotte
Stagg from Oxford University is going to
put a current through my head to show me

reaction times then I have my head
strapped up with damp electrode pads
which will pass small electric currents
from my brain this is pretty safe as
we're doing it in the hospital setting
but it goes without saying we don't
recommend you try this at home the brain
is an incredible electrical organ so the
cells are firing all the time and
connecting to each other like a massive
telephone cables and we learn things by
making the connections between these
cables stronger
what this does is use a little bit of

on average the tests showing 10%

researchers think this stimulation
